description: Difference between largest n-digit prime and smallest n+1 digit prime.
links: Pierre CAMI, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Next Prime.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Previous Prime.
example: 7 = greatest prime with 1 digit, 11 next smallest prime with 2 digits so a(1)=4.97 = greatest prime with 2 digits, 101 next smallest prime with 3 digits so a(2)=4.
author: _Jeff Burch_
extensions: Corrected and edited by _Patrick De Geest_, Nov 06 2004
